name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $identifier
desc: Returns: Id for specimen.

name: $addidentifier
desc: Id for specimen.

name: $accessionIdentifier
desc: Returns: The identifier assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The identifier assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures.

name: $status
desc: Returns: The availability of the specimen.

name: $::type
desc: Returns: The kind of material that forms the specimen.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The kind of material that forms the specimen.

name: $subject
desc: Returns: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance or a device.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance or a device.

name: $receivedTime
desc: Returns: Time when specimen was received for processing or testing.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Time when specimen was received for processing or testing.

name: $parent
desc: Returns: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of another specimen.

name: $addparent
desc: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of another specimen.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of another specimen.

name: $request
desc: Returns: Details concerning a service request that required a specimen to be collected.

name: $addrequest
desc: Details concerning a service request that required a specimen to be collected.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Details concerning a service request that required a specimen to be collected.

name: $collection
desc: Returns: Details concerning the specimen collection.

name: $processing
desc: Returns: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen.

name: $addprocessing
desc: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen.

name: $container
desc: Returns: The container holding the specimen.  The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

name: $addcontainer
desc: The container holding the specimen.  The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The container holding the specimen.  The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

name: $condition
desc: Returns: A mode or state of being that describes the nature of the specimen.

name: $addcondition
desc: A mode or state of being that describes the nature of the specimen.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: A mode or state of being that describes the nature of the specimen.

name: $note
desc: Returns: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).

name: $addnote
desc: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).
